articles.title: Elon Musk warns of 'dangerous technology' that he may have accelerated
articles.author: Jak Connor
articles.excerpt: Tesla, SpaceX, and Twitter CEO Elon Musk has warned of a 'dangerous technology' during a Tesla earnings call that he may have helped 'accelerate.'
articles.summary:
Tesla, SpaceX, and Twitter CEO Elon Musk has warned of a 'dangerous technology' during a Tesla earnings call that he may have helped 'accelerate.'
The emergence of new technologies, such as artificial intelligence in its various forms, has shaken up many industries around the world and has prominent figures in the tech world worried about its overall potential.
 
One of those prominent figures is SpaceX, Tesla, and Twitter CEO Elon Musk, who has recently been taking to his personal Twitter account to discuss the potential of AI-powered systems, while also poking fun at the people that were riding the cryptocurrency hype train that has now jumped over to the AI hype train.

articles.title: Twitter's Revenue Takes A Massive Nosedive After Advertisers Ditch The App: REPORT
articles.author: Madeline Dovi
articles.excerpt: Twitter's revenue dropped by nearly 40% in December after advertisers fled in the aftermath of CEO Elon Musk's acquisition of the platform, The Wall Street Journal reported Friday, citing sources…
articles.summary:
Share
Tweet
Subscribe: CDN Daily Briefing








Twitter's revenue dropped by nearly 40% in December after advertisers fled in the aftermath of CEO Elon Musk's acquisition of the platform, The Wall Street Journal reported Friday, citing sources familiar with the situation.


Twitter
 reported the year-over-year drop in both revenue and earnings in a message to the app's investors, the sources said, 
according
 to the WSJ. The company is currently working to pay off the nearly $13 billion in debt stemming from Musk's initial purchase, with yearly interest payments totaling approximately $1 billion.

articles.title: Elon Musk Roasts Dudes Pivoting From Crypto to AI
articles.author: Noor Al-Sibai
articles.excerpt: A broken clock is, as they say, right twice a day — and even Elon Musk, the king of the bad take, occasionally gets it right when it comes to AI.
articles.summary:
A broken clock is, as they say, right twice a day — and even Tesla CEO Elon Musk, the king of bad takes, 
occasionally gets it right
 when it comes to artificial intelligence.
"'I used to be in crypto,'" 
Musk tweeted
, pretend-quoting the kind of bros who, ironically, worship him, "'but now I got interested in AI.'"
While the 
crypto-to-AI pipeline
 is nothing new, it has, predictably, become 
a popular pivot
. The cryptocurrency industry faces record lows in 
value
 and 
public interest
 — while AI has become the hottest new trend in tech in large part thanks to the bombastic debut of 
OpenAI
's ChatGPT chatbot and Microsoft's Bing AI.

articles.title: Elon Musk says AI is 'dangerous technology' and needs regulating to ensure it's 'operating within the public interest'
articles.author: Sam Tabahriti
articles.excerpt: "I'm a little worried about AI stuff. I think it's something we should be concerned about," the Tesla CEO said at an investor day Wednesday.
articles.summary:
Elon Musk expressed his concerns about artificial intelligence at Tesla's investor day on Wednesday.
The Tesla CEO believed he "may have done some things" that accelerated the "dangerous technology."
His comments were prompted by an investor asking whether AI could help Musk make cars.
Elon Musk doesn't think artificial intelligence will help Tesla make cars "anytime soon."
He made the comment at Tesla's investor day on Wednesday in response to a question from a shareholder.
But he reiterated his concerns about the technology.

articles.title: Elon Musk must learn how to be boring to save Tesla
articles.author: Andrew Orlowski
articles.excerpt: Pundits tuning into Tesla's marathon annual investor day last week admitted being bored. So was the market: the company's share price fell by 5pc after a 'four-hour slog' that 'offered nothing much',…
articles.summary:
Pundits tuning into Tesla's marathon annual investor day last week admitted being bored. So was the market: the company's share price fell by 5pc after a 'four-hour slog' that 'offered nothing much', according to one business publication.
No new models were revealed, nor were eagerly awaited production dates or prices disclosed. Even the rock star chief executive himself, Elon Musk, was much more muted and low profile than in previous years
It was dull for a reason: the Chinese are coming, bringing cheap electric cars to Western markets, potentially in huge quantities.

articles.title: ChatGPT's CEO Warns the World That Artificial Intelligence Will 'Break Capitalism'
articles.author: Becker News
articles.excerpt: "OpenAI got started because [Elon Musk] warned that AI was going to take over the world..."
articles.summary:
ChatGPT has become one of the fastest-growing artificial intelligence bots in the world. It has also become a source of controversy as critics claim that it deploys bias and censorship in order to manipulate conversations and steers users towards 'Woke' conclusion, while defenders claim that such AI bots are only giving users information that is a reflection of the culture.


However, in a dystopian 
interview
 in Forbes, Sam Altman, the CEO of OpenAI, warns about the danger that artificial intelligence poses to free societies.

articles.title: Elon Musk Says 'What About Fun' After Biden Lists What Voting Can Achieve
articles.author: Shivdeep Dhaliwal
articles.excerpt: Elon Musk commented on a tweet by President Joe Biden's official Twitter account on Sunday in which the latter highlighted the importance of voting. What Happened: Biden said that a vote is an 'act of hope' and was about making 'real improvements' in everyday lives.
articles.summary:
Elon Musk commented on a tweet by President Joe Biden's official Twitter account on Sunday in which the latter highlighted the importance of voting.

A vote is an act of hope – but it's also about making real improvements in our everyday lives.
Voting is the path to good jobs.
Cleaner air and safer streets.
Affordable health care and better schools.
Equal justice.
And dignity.

— President Biden (@POTUS) March 5, 2023

The president said voting is a 'path to good jobs,' 'cleaner air and safer streets,' and 'dignity' among other things.

articles.title: Twitter's Revenue Takes A Massive Nosedive After Advertisers Ditch The App
articles.author: Daily Caller News Foundation
articles.excerpt: By Madeline Dovi Twitter's revenue dropped by nearly 40% in December after advertisers fled in the aftermath of CEO Elon Musk's acquisition of the platform, The Wall Street Journal reported Friday,…
articles.summary:
Elon Musk (Image: YouTube screen grab)
 
 
By Madeline Dovi


 
Twitter's revenue dropped by nearly 40% in December after advertisers fled in the aftermath of CEO Elon Musk's acquisition of the platform, The Wall Street Journal reported Friday, citing sources familiar with the situation.


Twitter
 reported the year-over-year drop in both revenue and earnings in a message to the app's investors, the sources said, 
according
 to the WSJ. The company is currently working to pay off the nearly $13 billion in debt stemming from Musk's initial purchase, with yearly interest payments totaling approximately $1 billion.

 reported the year-over-year drop in both revenue and earnings in a message to the app's investors, the sources said,

articles.title: This Week on Crypto Twitter: Lawyers Lay Into SEC, Elon Musk Cools on Crypto
articles.author: Tim Hakki
articles.excerpt: Visa's head of crypto this week emphatically denied that the payments giant was pausing its crypto push.
articles.summary:
Even though it was the first two consecutive weeks of losses this year, Crypto Twitter was largely unfazed. Instead, a host of other topics took center stage this week.
On Monday, a crypto-savvy lawyer who tweets under the handle @MetaLawMan took aim at Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) chair Gary Gensler for his agency's opaque approach to crypto and for the SEC's belligerent regulation-by-enforcement strategy. Three tweets into his thread he summarized the salient points of his criticism of Gensler.

articles.title: Twitter reports 40% drop in ad revenue, adjusted earnings for December: report
articles.author: Bradford Betz
articles.excerpt: Twitter's ad revenue and adjusted earnings dropped 40% year-over-year in December as hundreds of clients paused spending on the social media giant.
articles.summary:
Published
 March 5, 2023 4:40pm EST 
 
 
 
 
Twitter has reported a 40% year-over-year drop in ad revenue and adjusted earnings for December after a 
flurry of advertisers
 halted spending. 
 
The Wall Street Journal, citing people familiar with the matter, 
reported Friday
 that advertisers slashed their spending on Twitter after Elon Musk's chaotic $44 billion acquisition of the social media platform in late October. 
 
 
 
 
 
Elon Musk Twitter account displayed on a phone screen and Twitter logo displayed on a laptop screen are seen in this multiple exposure illustration photo taken in Poland on Dec.

articles.title: Tech rivals chase ChatGPT as AI race ramps up
articles.author: Tan Kw
articles.excerpt: Tech rivals chase ChatGPT as AI race ramps up
articles.summary:
WASHINGTON: 
Chasing Microsoft, global tech giants have rolled out announcements on how they will implement ChatGPT-like artificial intelligence into their world leading platforms and applications, with YouTube the latest to present plans.


 Here is a roundup of how the world's biggest tech companies plan to surf the AI wave:


 
Microsoft


 Microsoft has gone the furthest in pushing out generative AI to consumers and has pledged to pump billions of dollars into OpenAI, the company behind ChatGPT.

articles.title: Tesla cut the price of its most expensive models in the US
articles.author: Ananya Bhattacharya
articles.excerpt: The move comes two months after it cut prices of cheaper variants Model 3 and Model Y
articles.summary:
Tesla's two most expensive models in the US just got a little cheaper.

The basic and performance versions of the Model S and the pricier Model X have been slashed by between $5,000 and $10,000, according to the company's website.

Once a surprising move, price cuts are becoming more routine for the Texas-based automaker. Less than two months ago, in January, Tesla slashed prices across models in all markets by up to 20%, which made a host of vehicles more affordable and put them in a bracket that made them eligible for Biden's $7,500 electric vehicle (EV) subsidy.

articles.title: New Tesla Cybertruck: you'll finally be able to get your hands on bonkers electric pick-up in just MONTHS
articles.author: Paul Adam
articles.excerpt: The long-awaited Tesla Cybertruck is almost ready for deliveries to commence later this year, according to Tesla boss Elon Musk, who announced the news at Tesla's recent Investor Day presentation. …
articles.summary:
The long-awaited Tesla Cybertruck is almost ready for deliveries to commence later this year, according to Tesla boss Elon Musk, who announced the news at Tesla's recent Investor Day presentation.

After various setbacks, the futuristic-looking electric truck will be built at the firm's Texas Gigafactory

3

The original Cybertruck concept surprised the automotive world with its dramatic angular lines and features such as bulletproof glass, while it had a claimed maximum towing capacity of more than six tonnes.

articles.title: Elon Musk expects his fleet of Tesla 'Optimus' Bots to think, solve problems on own like his cars
articles.author: Study Finds
articles.excerpt: The humanoid Optimus robot was a showcase presentation at the Tesla 2023 Investor Day on March 1.
articles.summary:
AUSTIN, Texas —
 Elon Musk is showing off the progress on his 'Terminator'-style Tesla Bot. The humanoid Optimus robot was a showcase presentation at the Tesla 2023 Investor Day on March 1.


The billionaire tech entrepreneur showed off scenes of the robot working to repair others, in a room filled with spare arms, just like in the James Cameron sci-fi thrillers. The Tesla Bots were also walking around and 
performing tasks with tools
.


'It's worth bearing in mind that when we did AI day, this version of Optimus didn't walk at all.

articles.title: Tesla Model S, Model X Prices in the US Drop Anew
articles.author: Joseph Henry
articles.excerpt: This is the second that Tesla made a rollback for its EV prices this 2023.
articles.summary:
Joseph Henry
, Tech Times 
06 March 2023, 04:03 am
 
 
Tesla's US website shows that the Model S and Model X EVs are dropping their prices in the latest announcement.
 
The price cuts came after the company's CEO Elon Musk said that people should not be limited in their ability to purchase their desired Tesla vehicle.
 
Tesla Model S and Model X Price Drop
 
 
 
According to a report by
 TechCrunch
 on Monday, March 6, Tesla announced a new list for the pricing of its Model S and Model X cars in the US this year.

articles.title: Twitter Challenges Persist As December Revenues, Adjusted Earnings Dropped 40%
articles.author: EdJenner
articles.excerpt: Twitter Challenges Persist As December Revenues, Adjusted Earnings Dropped 40% The Wall Street Journal reported Friday night that Twitter Inc. sustained a year-over-year decrease of approximately 40%…
articles.summary:
The Wall Street Journal
 reported Friday night that Twitter Inc. sustained a year-over-year decrease of approximately 40% in both revenue and adjusted earnings for December. 
The report comes after a Jan. 24 
Reuters
 story, citing data by Standard Media Index (SMI), which showed a collapse in advertising spend on the social media platform by 71% in December. Since Elon Musk's takeover in October, there has been an 
exodus of advertisers
. 
At the time, SMI said Twitter's ad business was beginning to stabilize after offering a 'slew of initiatives to win back advertisers, offering some free ads, lifting a ban on political advertising and allowing companies greater control over the positioning of their ads,' Reuters said.

articles.title: Billy Markus: Introducing Dogecoin's Co-Founder Shibetoshi Nakamoto
articles.author: Finn Miller
articles.excerpt: Billy Markus is the creator of Dogecoin, the cryptocurrency memecoin. Who's the man behind Elon Musk's favorite blockchain?
articles.summary:
When Dogecoin co-founder Billy Markus created DOGE, he had no idea that the meme coin would become one of the world's most popular cryptocurrencies. What began as a simple joke between friends created billionaires and rallied the crypto community around the power of memes.

Bitcoin (BTC) and Ethereum (ETH) might be the future of finance, but DOGE made crypto relatable to thousands for the first time.

What do we know about the man behind digital currency's most accessible altcoin? Why did the founder of Dogecoin (DOGE) abandon the blockchain project after less than two years into its lifespan?

Your questions about the creator of Dogecoin; answered.

articles.title: Tesla cuts prices of Model S and Model X variants in U.S.
articles.summary: Tesla Inc has cut prices of its Model S and Model X vehicles in the United States, its website showed, days after chief executive Elon Musk said recent price cuts of other models had stoked demand.

articles.title: ChatGPT, Tech Map, Capital Story: Unveiling the Mystery Boss
articles.author: Rina Giannino
articles.excerpt: OpenAI, the company behind ChatGPT, has become the fastest-growing consumer application in history. With more than 30 executives, engineers, and
articles.summary: OpenAI, the company behind ChatGPT, has become the fastest-growing consumer application in history. With more than 30 executives, engineers, and researchers leaving the company to start their own companies, OpenAI has raised over US$1 billion in financing and created the 'OpenAI Mafia', a powerful network of talent, social connections, and capital opportunities. This new generation of AI companies is driving a new round of technological frenzy and investment opportunities, and OpenAI is dedicated to helping humans realize their beautiful vision with an elite team.
articles.authors: Rina Giannino,Rina Has Been A Follower

articles.title: Challenge Accepted: Giga Mexico To Be Built Faster Than Giga Shanghai
articles.author: Jeremy Johnson
articles.excerpt: We just saw Tom Zhu, head of Tesla's production efforts say that he wants to see Giga Mexico built faster than Giga Shanghai.
articles.summary:
Giga Mexico Time To Build

Tom Zhu is the head of Tesla's U.S. assembly plants and sales operations in North America and Europe told the Governor of Nuevo León in Mexico, the location where Giga Mexico will be built, that he wants to see that giga factory break the record of being built in 9 months by Giga Shanghai.

Tom Zhu is a very important person at Tesla. He helped get Giga Shanghai built and running at record speed, and he knows a lot about how mass production works. Getting a vehicle to volume production is no easy task, and all the experience Tom has gained is going to be very valuable for Giga Mexico AND future factories.

articles.title: Turkish competition board says fines Elon Musk over Twitter takeover
articles.author: Reuters
articles.excerpt: Turkish competition board says fines Elon Musk over Twitter takeover
articles.summary:
Turkish competition board says fines Elon Musk over Twitter takeover
The Turkish Competition Board said on Monday it had decided to fine billionaire Elon Musk 0.1% of Twitter's gross income in Turkey in 2022, as his takeover of the company occurred without the board's permission.
Reporting by Daren Butler, Editing by Humeyra Pamuk
 
Read more:
 »
 
China set a modest target for economic growth this year of around 5% on Sunday as it kicked off the annual session of its National People's Congress (NPC), which is poised to implement the biggest government shake-up in a decade.

articles.title: Elon Musk calls for government regulation of artificial intelligence
articles.excerpt: (Austin, TX) -- Elon Musk is calling for the government to regulate artificial intelligence. The Tesla CEO gave a three-hour presentation this week to investors at the Tesla factory in Austin, Texas,…
articles.summary:
(Austin, TX) -- Elon Musk is calling for the government to regulate artificial intelligence.


The Tesla CEO gave a three-hour presentation this week to investors at the Tesla factory in Austin, Texas, and laid out his "Master Plan 3" on how to expand the company and convert the world to clean energy.


The presentation included a video of the company's new humanoid robot, and Tesla executives explained how artificial intelligence was being used to train vehicles to drive themselves.


Musk warned, however, that AI is "quite dangerous technology," and said "regulatory authority" might be needed to "make sure it's operating in the public interest.

articles.title: Tesla, the drive-in restaurant is back in fashion
articles.excerpt: The Tesla restaurantRecharging an electric car often takes a long time: several tens of minutes in the best cases, hours
articles.summary:
The Tesla restaurant
Recharging an electric car often takes a long time: several tens of minutes in the best cases, hours in the worst. To ensure that these gaps in time can be filled in a carefree manner, Tesla is pursuing the idea of ​​building a restaurant in Hollywood in which you can eat while the energy inside the battery is restored: it is a project that had already been mentioned by Elon Musk several years ago, in 2018, and which has come back into fashion after the first Investor Day of Tesla which took place a few days ago.

articles.title: Tesla cuts prices of Model S and Model X variants in US- website
articles.author: Reuters
articles.excerpt: Tesla Inc has cut prices of its Model S and Model X vehicles in the U.S., its website showed, days after its chief executive Elon Musk said that the recent price cuts of its other models had stoked demand.
articles.summary:
March 5 (Reuters) - Tesla Inc (TSLA.O) has cut prices of its Model S and Model X vehicles in the U.S., its website showed, days after its chief executive Elon Musk said that the recent price cuts of its other models had stoked demand.

Prices of Tesla's Model S cars were cut by $5,000. The basic version of Model S would now cost $89,990 from $94,990 before, while its performance variant would cost $109,990 from $114,990 earlier.

articles.title: Companies Jockey For Partners As Satcom Industry Transforms
articles.author: Irene Klotz
articles.excerpt: The newest players in the space industry have some familiar names.
articles.summary:
https://aviationweek.com/themes/custom/particle/dist/app-drupal/assets/awn-logo.svg
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
The CEOs of T-Mobile and SpaceX, Mike Sievert (left) and Elon Musk, announced their partnership in Boca Chica Beach, Texas, in August.
 
Credit: Michael Gonzalez/Getty Images
 
 
 
 
The satellite communications industry, which is still reckoning with the game-changing arrival of the first megaconstellations, faces a potentially even more transformative technology: the expansion of cellphone service into space.

articles.title: Donald Trump wants flying cars. Elon Musk says they're a dumb idea
articles.author: Steve Mollman
articles.excerpt: "If somebody doesn't maintain their flying car, it could drop a hubcap and guillotine you," said Tesla CEO Elon Musk.
articles.summary:
Donald Trump released a video Friday in which he pushed for futuristic American cities and flying cars.





"Just as the United States led the automotive revolution in the last century, I want to ensure that America—not China—leads this revolution in air mobility,' says the 2024 Republican presidential candidate in the video.
But Elon Musk, the CEO of Tesla and SpaceX, already dismissed the notion that flying cars are the future of transportation. Back in 2017, Musk told Bloomberg that flying cars were a dumb idea, at least for city travel.

articles.title: Tesla cuts prices of Model Y and Model X variants in US- website
articles.author: Reuters
articles.excerpt: Prices of Tesla's Model S cars were cut by $5,000. The basic version of Model S would now cost $89,990 from $94,990 before, while its performance variant would cost $109,990 from $114,990 earlier. Prices of both the performance and basic variants of Model X cars were cut by $10,000, the electric vehicle maker's website showed.
articles.summary:
(Reuters) - Tesla Inc has cut prices of its Model S and Model X vehicles in the U.S., its website showed, days after its chief executive Elon Musk said that the recent price cuts of its other models had stoked demand.
Prices of Tesla's Model S cars were cut by $5,000. The basic version of Model S would now cost $89,990 from $94,990 before, while its performance variant would cost $109,990 from $114,990 earlier.
Prices of both the performance and basic variants of Model X cars were cut by $10,000, the electric vehicle maker's website showed.

articles.title: Elon Musk's Latest Reveal? His Tesla Management Team
articles.author: Tim Higgins
articles.excerpt: Billed as a glimpse into Tesla's future, Investor Day was used as an opportunity to spotlight the company's leadership bench.
articles.summary:
Usually, the cars are the stars.
But this week, 
Elon Musk
 went out of his way to highlight Tesla Inc.'s management team—even if Wall Street was eager for an update on efforts to develop a new, cheap electric car.

articles.title: Turkish competition board says fines Elon Musk over Twitter takeover
articles.author: Reuters
articles.excerpt: The Turkish Competition Board said on Monday it had decided to fine billionaire Elon Musk 0.1% of Twitter's gross income in Turkey in 2022, as his takeover of the company occurred without the board's permission.
articles.summary:
Twitter logo and Elon Musk silhouette are seen in this illustration taken, December 19, 2022. REUTERS/Dado Ruvic/Illustration
ISTANBUL, March 6 (Reuters) - The Turkish Competition Board said on Monday it had decided to fine billionaire Elon Musk 0.1% of Twitter's gross income in Turkey in 2022, as his takeover of the company occurred without the board's permission.
The board said in a statement that the ruling would be open to a legal challenge.
Reporting by Daren Butler, Editing by Humeyra Pamuk
Our Standards: 
The Thomson Reuters Trust Principles.

articles.title: Tesla Investor Day 2023: $25,000 Next Gen Vehicle To Be Made In Mexico
articles.author: James Morris
articles.excerpt: Tesla Investor Day 2023 caused a plunge in share price. But have shareholders missed the value of what was presented?
articles.summary:
There is usually a lot of excitement around Tesla's announcement days, such as 
Battery Day 2020
 and 
AI Day 2022
. There had been considerable anticipation ahead of Investor Day 2023, too, with details expected about 
Project Highland
 and the 
Next Generation Platform
. However, while the latter was regularly mentioned in passing, there were no grand presentations. The disappointment meant share prices dropped, 
wiping $44 billion off Tesla's valuation
. But were investors failing to see the gems amongst the avalanche of information?


Tesla Investor Day may not have been well received by shareholders, but it still included some 
.

articles.title: Elon Musk Says 'Sorry' For Turning Twitter Into A Place That Has 'Trolls' — But No, He Is Not Apologizing
articles.author: Ananya Gairola
articles.excerpt: Twitter CEO Elon Musk, while sharing a news report on the social media platform about the site not being able to protect users from trolls, said, 'Sorry' — but it was laced with sarcasm.
articles.summary: Twitter CEO Elon Musk, while sharing a news report on the social media platform about the site not being able to protect users from trolls, said, 'Sorry' — but it was laced with sarcasm.

articles.title: Tesla Slashes Prices of Model S, Model X in US For Second Time This Year
articles.author: Dana Hull
articles.excerpt: Tesla Inc. slashed prices of its Model S sedan and Model X SUV in the US late Sunday night by $5,000 and $10,000 respectively as the company seeks to goose demand in the final month of the quarter.
articles.summary:
(Bloomberg) -- Tesla Inc. slashed prices of its Model S sedan and Model X SUV in the US late Sunday night by $5,000 and $10,000 respectively as the company seeks to goose demand in the final month of the quarter.

The Model S all-wheel drive is now $89,990, down 5.2% from $94,990, according to the company's website. The Model S Plaid is now $109,990, down 4.3% from $114,990.
The Model X all-wheel drive is now $99,990, down 9.1% from $109,990. The Model X Plaid is now $109,990, down 8.3% from $119,990.

articles.title: Elon Musk Says 'Sorry' For Turning Twitter Into A Place That Has 'Trolls' — But No He Is Not Apologizing
articles.author: Aveek Bhowmik
articles.excerpt: Twitter CEO Elon Musk, while sharing a news report on the social media platform about the site not being able to protect users from trolls, said, 'Sorry' — but it was laced with sarcasm.
articles.summary:
Twitter CEO Elon Musk, while sharing a news report on the social media platform about the site not being able to protect users from trolls, said, 'Sorry' — but it was laced with sarcasm.

What Happened: Sharing a screenshot of a news report by BBC titled, 'Twitter can't protect you from trolls any more, insiders say' Musk said, 'Sorry for turning Twitter from nurturing paradise into place that has … trolls.'



— Elon Musk (@elonmusk) March 6, 2023

Musk replied on the same thread saying, '(real article from organization calling itself bbc).

articles.title: Warren Buffett-backed Chinese EV maker BYD has seen $18 billion in value wiped out amid Tesla's price war
articles.author: George Glover
articles.excerpt: BYD''s stock price has fallen 14% since the start of February, with rival EV maker Tesla up 9% in the same period as it pushes ahead with reductions for buyers.
articles.summary:
Warren Buffett-backed BYD has suffered an $18 billion wipeout in value over the past month as rival EV maker 
Tesla
 presses ahead with a price war.
US-listed shares in the Chinese carmaker
 have fallen 14% since February 1, to trade at just under $58 as of Friday's close. By comparison, BlackRock's 
iShares Self-Driving EV & Tech ETF
, which tracks listed companies in the sector, has fallen 5% over the same period.
BYD's fall has dragged its total US market capitalization down to $104 billion in the space of just over a month, according to data from Bloomberg and 
CompaniesMarketCap
.

articles.title: Tesla Cuts U.S. Prices as It Looks to Boost First-Quarter Sales
articles.author: Brian Swint
articles.excerpt: The electric-vehicle company lowers prices for the Model S and Model X.
articles.summary:
Tesla, the electric-vehicle company run by billionaire Elon Musk, lowered prices for its Model S and Model X vehicles on Sunday, potentially giving a boost to sales in the final month of the first quarter.

Tesla (ticker: TSLA) shares rose 0.9% to $199.52 in premarket trading Monday. The stock has rebounded 60% this year but remains more than 26% down from a year ago.

Based on postings on Tesla's website, the price for a Model S was dropped $5,000, bringing the basic version to $89,990. The cost of the Model X SUV was dropped by $10,000, bringing the tag for the basic version to $99,990.

articles.title: Tesla cuts prices of Model S and Model X variants in U.S.
articles.author: Reuters
articles.excerpt: Prices of Tesla's Model S cars were cut by $5,000. Prices of both the performance and basic variants of Model X cars were cut by $10,000, the electric vehicle maker's website showed. Musk has said…
articles.summary:
(Reuters) -Tesla Inc has cut prices of its Model S and Model X vehicles in the United States, its website showed, days after chief executive Elon Musk said recent price cuts of other models had stoked demand.
Prices of Tesla's Model S cars were cut by $5,000. The basic version of Model S would now cost $89,990, down from $94,990 before, while its performance variant would cost $109,990, from $114,990 earlier.
Prices of both the performance and basic variants of Model X cars were cut by $10,000, the electric vehicle maker's website showed.

articles.title: Elon Musk Says Twitter Plans To Roll Out Individual DM Replies And Encryption Very Soon
articles.author: Bibhu Pattnaik
articles.excerpt: Twitter CEO Elon Musk has hinted that the company aims to roll out the ability to reply to individual DMs.
articles.summary:
Twitter CEO Elon Musk has hinted that the company aims to roll out the ability to reply to individual DMs.

He also mentioned that Twitter would make the use of reaction emojis and encryption available on the platform in March.



— Elon Musk (@elonmusk) March 5, 2023

One of Musk's followers responded to the announcement, "Great updates that will help conversations flow more smoothly. Particularly looking forward to a variety of reaction emoji's... it's the little things."

Earlier in February, Musk said that the social media platform would allow users to adjust the algorithm to their "closer match.

articles.title: Tesla Cuts US Prices Of Premium Models Again: Here's How Much Model S, X Cost Now
articles.author: Shanthi Rexaline
articles.excerpt: Tesla, Inc.
articles.summary:
What Happened: Updated price information on Tesla's website showed price reductions in the range of 4.4%-9.1% for the Model X crossover SUV and the Model S liftback sedan.

Here are details of the price changes for these premium models of the Austin Texas-based company:

Model X dual motor, all-wheel drive: $99,990, down 9.1% from $109,990
Model X Plaid tri-motor AWD: $109,990, down 8.3% from $119,990
Model S dual-motor AWD: $89,990 down 5.3% from $94,990
Model S Plaid tri-motor AWD: $109,990 down 4.

articles.summary:
(Bloomberg) -- Tesla Inc. slashed prices of its Model S sedan and Model X SUV in the US late Sunday night by $5,000 and $10,000 respectively as the company seeks to goose demand in the final month of the quarter.

World's Riskiest Markets Stumble Into Crisis With Dollars Scarce
The Model S all-wheel drive is now $89,990, down 5.2% from $94,990, according to the company's website. The Model S Plaid is now $109,990, down 4.3% from $114,990.

articles.title: Donald Trump wants flying cars. Elon Musk says they're a dumb idea
articles.author: Steve Mollman
articles.excerpt: "If somebody doesn't maintain their flying car, it could drop a hubcap and guillotine you," said Tesla CEO Elon Musk.
articles.summary:
Donald Trump released a video Friday in which he pushed for futuristic American cities and flying cars. 
 
'Just as the United States led the automotive revolution in the last century, I want to ensure that America—not China—leads this revolution in air mobility,' says the 2024 Republican presidential candidate in the video.
 
But Elon Musk, the CEO of 
Tesla
 and 
SpaceX
, already dismissed the notion that flying cars are the future of transportation. Back in 2017, Musk 
told Bloomberg
 that flying cars were a dumb idea, at least for city travel.

articles.title: Turkish competition board says fines Elon Musk over Twitter takeover
articles.author: Reuters
articles.excerpt: The Turkish Competition Board said on Monday it had decided to fine billionaire Elon Musk 0.1% of Twitter's gross income in Turkey in 2022, as his takeover of the company occurred without the board's permission. The board said in a statement that the ruling would be open to a legal challenge.
articles.summary:
ISTANBUL, March 6 (Reuters) - The Turkish Competition Board said on Monday it had decided to fine billionaire Elon Musk 0.1% of Twitter's gross income in Turkey in 2022, as his takeover of the company occurred without the board's permission.
The board said in a statement that the ruling would be open to a legal challenge.
(Reporting by Daren Butler, Editing by Humeyra Pamuk)
